p1MemorySystem

Class P1MemSystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • p1MemorySystem.P1MemSystem
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MemorySystem

    public class P1MemSystem
extends java.lang.Object
implements MemorySystem
    This class implements a memory system and it's basic functions.
    Author:
    samus250

    • Method Detail

      • reserveMemory

        public int reserveMemory(int size)
                  throws FullMemoryException
        Description copied from interface: MemorySystem
        Tries to reserve a block of memory that consists of the specified number of bytes. These bytes must be available at the moment of invocation. If successful, all reserved byte are initialized to contain the char value �1�.
        Specified by:
        reserveMemory in interface MemorySystem
        Parameters:
        size - the number of contiguous bytes to reserve
        Returns:
        a positive integer value corresponding of the address of the first byte in the block that has been reserved. This would mean that there was at least one contiguous block of �size� bytes that were free. those bytes will then be recorded as reserved. If no such block of contiguous free blocks is found, the value to return is -1 and no further action is done by this method.
        Throws:
        FullMemoryException - if memory has no free left.

      • freeMemory

        public void freeMemory(int address,
                       int size)
        Description copied from interface: MemorySystem
        Tries to free the block of memory of the size given at the address given. If possible, the block of bytes is freed and properly recorded. If not successful, it prints proper error messages. If successful, all bytes that were freed are assigned the char value '0'
        Specified by:
        freeMemory in interface MemorySystem
        Parameters:
        address - - The start address of the memory to free.
        size - - The size of the memory to be freed.

      • showMMASCII

        public void showMMASCII(int initialAddress,
                        int finalAddress)
        Description copied from interface: MemorySystem
        Displays the content of memory from a given initial address up to a final address. The content must show the address of the byte and its content as a a character � it shows the char value of the content treated as an ASCII code.
        Specified by:
        showMMASCII in interface MemorySystem
        Parameters:
        initialAddress - the address of the first byte
        finalAddress - the address of the last byte PRE: 0 <= initialAddress <= finalAddress < memory_size.
